tables.table_schema: CREATE TABLE architects (architect_id INT PRIMARY KEY, architect_name VARCHAR(50), project_id INT, collaboration_status BOOLEAN)

CREATE TABLE collaborations (
    collab_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_id INT,
    architect_id INT,
    other_professional_id INT,
    notes TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (architect_id) REFERENCES architects(architect_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (other_professional_id) REFERENCES professionals(professional_id)
);

CREATE TABLE projects (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_name VARCHAR,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE collaborations (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    architect_id INT,
    project_id INT,
    collaboration_type VARCHAR,
    FOREIGN KEY (architect_id) REFERENCES architects(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects(id)
);

CREATE TABLE architects (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 name VARCHAR(50),
 email VARCHAR(50),
 phone_number VARCHAR(15)
)

CREATE TABLE projects (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 project_name VARCHAR(100),
 start_date DATE,
 end_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE collaborators (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 name VARCHAR(50),
 email VARCHAR(50),
 profession VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE communications (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 message TEXT,
 sender_id INT,
 receiver_id INT,
 timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE projects (
    project_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    budget DECIMAL(10, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE project_architects (
    project_id INT,
    architect_id INT,
    PRIMARY KEY(project_id, architect_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects(project_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (architect_id) REFERENCES architects(architect_id)
);

CREATE TABLE project_collaborators (
    project_id INT,
    collaborator_id INT,
    PRIMARY KEY(project_id, collaborator_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects(project_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (collaborator_id) REFERENCES collaborators(collaborator_id)
);
